revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Verizon |model=VRE3000 |series=AC3000 |fcc_date=08/14/2018 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=U-MEDIA |type=range extender |fcc_id=SI5VRE3000 |pcb_id=0500-2540921000 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7621AT |cpu1_cspeed=880 |cpu1_cores=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7615DN |wi1_chip2_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip2_model=MT7615DN |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi2_chip1_model=MT7615N |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=4 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=2 |flags=Wave2, MU-MIMO, 256QAM, 802.11k, DFS (master), |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=Verizon Extender Setup - XXXX |default_ip=192.168.0.250 |oui_eth=00:11:E0, }}
:• '''1733''' Mbps - 4SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.) backhaul :• '''867''' Mbps - 2SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.) :• '''400''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan., 256QAM) = '''''AC3000'' class'''
{{TagLine|Verizon 5G Home Wi-Fi Extender}} {{See also|Linksys RE9000}} "0500-2540921000" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. CPU and WI1/WI2 chip IDs are not legible in the FCC photos. The components and design strongly resemble the [[Linksys RE9000]] which is also from [[U-MEDIA]]. Chips are assumed to be the same. The user manual claims that DFS support will come in the future. DFS certification was added with a C2PC request on 2/26/2019. {{WiFiCert|WFA78579|07/24/2018}} * Web GUI: http://verizonre (PC), http://verizonre.local (MAC)
